intro: Sayeria uncipes, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically features succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. Its root system is shallow but extensive, allowing it to spread and colonize disturbed soils. Sayeria uncipes is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
